intro: Phaulanthus rudis, commonly known as the rough phaulanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, providing protection against desiccation. The flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in a dense head, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
